item.title: How to remove the signature from e-mails with NLP?
item.description: Some time ago I stumbled across EmailParser, a Python utility to remove e-mail signatures. Here’s a sample input e-mail from the project documentation. Wendy – thanks for the intro! Moving you to bcc. Hi Vincent – nice to meet you over email. Apologize for the late reply, I was on PTO for a couple weeks and this is my first week back in office. As Wendy mentioned, I am leading an AR/VR taskforce at Foobar Retail Solutions.

item.title: Natural Language Processing and Natural Language Understanding
item.description: I used Natural Language Processing (NLP) tools in a few projects in the past years. But only recently, while involved with a chatbot project, I noticed the term Natural Language Understanding (NLU). NLU can be seen as a subfield of NLP. NLP englobes all techniques used for parsing text and extracting some knowledge about it. It could be finding out what are the common entities in the text, calculating the likelihood of a certain word being a preposition or a verb, sentiment analysis, or even spell checking sentences.

item.title: Using Google Natural Language API in an AWS Elastic Beanstalk application
item.description: Besides providing an API for users and developers, Google also provides a series of (very well-written) client implementation, in several programming languages. That’s the case for Google Storage, Google Vision, and for Google Natural Language API’s. I recently had to use the latter in a POC at work, and ran into an interesting issue with our AWS Elastic Beanstalk environment. Google Language API requires that clients authenticate before sending requests. If you use their google-cloud-java, you can define the GOOGLE_APPLICATION_CREDENTIALS.
